data.title: Survey shows 20 per cent of pensioners would re-enter the workforce
data.meta_description:
A recent National Seniors survey of 4000 pensioners revealed 20 per cent would consider re-entering the workforce.

Chief Advocate for National Seniors Australia Ian Henschke says if more pensioners joined the workforce, it would be a “gamechanger for the Australian economy”.

“What we’ve got to recognise is that 30 per cent of women in Australia retire with no superannuation. So this myth that everybody’s got superannuation…no, there are 24 per cent of Australian pensioners who are living in poverty,” he told Sky News host Cory Bernardi.

“This is a classic example of lack of leadership in Australia.”
data.text:
A recent National Seniors survey of 4000 pensioners revealed 20 per cent would consider re-entering the workforce.

Chief Advocate for National Seniors Australia Ian Henschke says if more pensioners joined the workforce, it would be a “gamechanger for the Australian economy”.

“What we’ve got to recognise is that 30 per cent of women in Australia retire with no superannuation. So this myth that everybody’s got superannuation…no, there are 24 per cent of Australian pensioners who are living in poverty,” he told Sky News host Cory Bernardi.

“This is a classic example of lack of leadership in Australia.”
